intro: Phyllanthus paxianus, commonly known as the Mexican spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. Phyllanthus paxianus is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils.
